text: when you combine all your data into a
single place you'll be able to improve
experiences for your customers let's say
you're running the marketing function
for an e-commerce business you are
looking to create targeted offers that
help improve the experiences of your
high value customers but before you can
create targeted offers you need to
better understand your customers now in
a modern digital business customer data
is scattered in different places the
customer's purchase history lives in a
relational database such as Amazon
Aurora you may have all their email
correspondence in a few different tools
you've got recordings and transcripts of
phone calls with customer support and
that's in your support system and you
have the click stream data from all
their activity on your store which is in
your analytics system all this data is
siled away in a bunch of separate
services and data stores with a data
Lake built on Amazon S3 your it team can
combine all the structured and
unstructured data in a single place to
create a complete view of of all your
customers developers can build an
application to tap into this data your
data and business analysts can use this
application for granular customer
analysis for example the analysts can
identify High spending customers that
have had a bad experience recently you
could surface the fact that the last
time they've called customer support
have all been about a defective product
that they need to replace based on this
information you get your operations team
to proactively expedite the shipment of
the replacement product you could use
Amazon sagemaker to run predictions to
identify a subset of customers that have
a high cancellation risk based on
customer churn models that you have
perfected over time you use this insight
to offer these customers a value-added
service such as shopping concierge or
free product setup the end results by
combining all your disparate data into a
single place and by running ml
predictions you're able to improve the
experiences for your customers
